column5: Fishing a river or a creek/stream?  I know I post alot of these threads but they help myself, and I'm pretty sure they also help alot of other people with the common steelheading questions.  I've got the night free and trying to figure out where I want to go.  It's raining lightly outside right now, and I think the rain is supposed to continue for most of the afternoon.  My original idea was going back to my spot at the Caledonia Dam, but I've heard that it won't be good today, but tomorrow/the rest of the weekend.  Feel free to PM me any good creeks  lol.  Thanks
Fish for Northern Pike.. that's what I'm doing today. Big boys come out to play in the Fall...
I'm staying in tonight and heading out on the weekend.  Did you ever get waders?
Yeah. I've had a pair for a couple weeks now.  They've been used extensively   (Including a few accidental swims lol)
Be careful, you"ll frighten the fish away. But seriously, be careful.

Alright ....ill give in ...if your up for a drive .. pm me....ill take ya out fishing and put you in front of fish....but ...you have to promise to do a composite drawing of your catches...lmao...splash and dutchy  and Laz should make the extra travel time too...
LOL.  I'm totally up for it. I'll send you a pm. lol
Thanks for the invite Dave but I'm keeping it 'somewhat' local this weekend. Too much baby related matter to deal with.
Not many other things in this world more important then whats comming your way ...  ...smart choice ...
I think I'm gonna head out to Caledonia in about 20 minutes..  I wasn't thinking and my roe hasnt defrosted completely.  Guess I'll have to stop at that bait shop and pick some up
